channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Bennett Parten, Somewhere Toward Freedom
channel.desc: Author Bennett Parten discusses Union General William Sherman's 1864 March to the Sea, a critical Civil War campaign that destroyed the Confederacy, from the perspective of the enslaved people who fled to the Union lines.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: Documenting research and development conducted by the U.S. Postal Service and its efforts to improve safety and speed of mail processing through technology.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Supreme Court Civil Rights Mystery
channel.desc: The U.S. Supreme Court chamber is the setting for a lecture about African American law student Lloyd Gaines, who challenged a law school's segregation policy - but then disappeared after the court ruled in his favor in 1938.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Boston College communications professor Michael Serazio discusses how baseball connects Americans to their past and culture.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: A 1951 Armed Forces Information Service film dramatizes the effects of an imagined Communist invasion on an American small town.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Even the food at the White House is political - and imbued with cultural and diplomatic messages. This is a day-long symposium featuring a former White House chef, food historians, and White House scholars.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1938 New York Port Authority film covers the planning, construction and operation of the Lincoln Tunnel, which connects New York to New Jersey and opens in December 1937.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: The American Civil War Museum in Richmond, Virginia, hosts authors and historians discussing Civil War topics.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Frank Garmon, a Wonderful Career in Crime
channel.desc: Author Frank Garmon discusses Charles Cowlam's career as a convict, spy, detective, congressional candidate, adventurer and con artist during the Civil War era.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: International Spy Museum Tour
channel.desc: International Spy Museum historian and curator Andrew Hammond highlights espionage tools and artifacts from the museum's collection.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Joyce Chaplin, The Franklin Stove
channel.desc: Harvard University professor Joyce Chaplin talks about Benjamin Franklin as a scientist and how the stove he invented in 1742 became a popular product in and beyond the U.S.
